org.jtrim2.taskgraph.basic

Class TaskNode<R,I>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim2.taskgraph.basic.TaskNode<R,I>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - the return type of the task nodes created by the defined task node factory
    I - the type of the argument passed to the task node factory when requested for a node to be created

    public final class TaskNode<R,I>
extends Object
    Defines a task node which can be computed once. The task node can also be marked as finished externally.

    Thread safety

    Methods of this class are allowed to be used by multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this interface are not synchronization transparent unless otherwise noted.
    See Also:
    CollectingTaskGraphBuilder, TaskGraphExecutorFactory

      Creates a new TaskNode with the given node key and task.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TaskNode

        public TaskNode(TaskNodeKey<R,I> key,
                NodeTaskRef<R> nodeTask)
        Creates a new TaskNode with the given node key and task.
        Parameters:
        key - the key uniquely identifying this node in the task graph. This argument cannot be null.
        nodeTask - the task of the action with the properties of the task node. This argument cannot be null.

      • TaskNode

        public TaskNode(TaskNodeKey<R,I> key,
                NodeTaskRef<R> nodeTask,
                CompletableFuture<R> taskFuture)
        Creates a new TaskNode with the given node key and task.
        Parameters:
        key - the key uniquely identifying this node in the task graph. This argument cannot be null.
        nodeTask - the task of the action with the properties of the task node. This argument cannot be null.
        taskFuture - the CompletableFuture for which the output of this task will be set once, it completes. This argument cannot be null.

    • Method Detail

      • getKey

        public TaskNodeKey<R,I> getKey()
        Returns the TaskNodeKey uniquely identifying this task in the task graph.

        This method is synchronization transparent.

        Returns:
        the TaskNodeKey uniquely identifying this task in the task graph. This method never returns null.

      • taskFuture

        public CompletableFuture<R> taskFuture()
        Returns the CompletableFuture holding the result of the output of this task node.

        Note: It is preferable to call the cancel or the propagateFailure method to directly completing the returned CompletableFuture because the mentioned methods will also remove the reference to the actual task to be executed.

        Returns:
        the CompletableFuture holding the result of the output of this task node. This method never returns null.

      • ensureScheduleComputed

        public void ensureScheduleComputed(CancellationToken cancelToken,
                                   TaskErrorHandler errorHandler)
        Schedules this task node for computation if it was not scheduled yet. This method is idempotent: That is, once it has been called, subsequent calls do nothing.
        Parameters:
        cancelToken - the CancellationToken which can signal that a task execution is to be canceled. There is no guarantee that the cancellation will not be ignored. This argument cannot be null.
        errorHandler - the callback to be notified in case the task encounters an error. This argument cannot be null.

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Cancels the computation of this node if it was not computed yet. If this task node was already completed, this method does nothing.

      • propagateFailure

        public void propagateFailure(Throwable error)
        Completes this task node exceptionally with the given error if it was not completed yet. If this task node was already completed, this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        error - the error with which this task node is to be completed with. This argument cannot be null.

      • hasResult

        public boolean hasResult()
        Returns true if this task node has already completed successfully and has its result set. That is, if this method returns true, subsequent calls to getResult() will succeed without throwing an exception.
        Returns:
        true if this task node has already completed successfully and has its result set, false otherwise

      • getResult

        public R getResult()
        Returns the output of this node or throws an exception if it was completed exceptionally.

        This method may only be called after it is known that this task node has been completed.

        Returns:
        the output of this node or throws an exception if it was completed exceptionally. This method may return null, if the task's output was null.
        Throws:
        CompletionException - thrown if this task node has been completed exceptionally (except if it was completed with CancellationException or OperationCanceledException. The cause of the CompletionException contains the exception thrown during the computation.
        OperationCanceledException - thrown if computation was canceled before this node could have been computed
        IllegalStateException - thrown if this task node has not been completed yet

      • getExpectedResultNow

        public static <R> R getExpectedResultNow(TaskNodeKey<?,?> key,
                                         CompletableFuture<? extends R> future)
        Returns the output from the given CompletableFuture translating CancellationException to OperationCanceledException.

        This method differs from getResultNow from throwing an IllegalStateException if the given CompletableFuture has not been completed yet.

        Type Parameters:
        R - the type of the result of the computation associated with the given CompletableFuture
        Parameters:
        key - the key to be added to the error message of the possible IllegalStateException.
        future - the CompletableFuture.
        Returns:
        the result of with which the given CompletableFuture has been completed with. This method may return null, if the CompletableFuture was completed normally with null.
        Throws:
        CompletionException - thrown if the given CompletableFuture has been completed exceptionally (except if it was completed with CancellationException or OperationCanceledException. The cause of the CompletionException contains the exception thrown during the computation.
        OperationCanceledException - thrown if the given CompletableFuture was completed with a CancellationException or an OperationCanceledException
        IllegalStateException - if the given CompletableFuture has not been completed yet

      • getResultNow

        public static <R> R getResultNow(CompletableFuture<? extends R> future)
        Returns the output from the given CompletableFuture translating CancellationException to OperationCanceledException.
        Type Parameters:
        R - the type of the result of the computation associated with the given CompletableFuture
        Parameters:
        future - the CompletableFuture.
        Returns:
        the result of with which the given CompletableFuture has been completed with or null if the given CompletableFuture has been completed yet
        Throws:
        CompletionException - thrown if the given CompletableFuture has been completed exceptionally (except if it was completed with CancellationException or OperationCanceledException. The cause of the CompletionException contains the exception thrown during the computation.
        OperationCanceledException - thrown if the given CompletableFuture was completed with a CancellationException or an OperationCanceledException
